caseFiles.chief_complaint: Burning sensation in stomach after meals
caseFiles.raw_notes: Patient reports acidity, worse at night. No fever. Takes occasional antacids. Diet includes spicy food.
caseFiles.structured_summary: 45-year-old male presenting with burning sensation in stomach after meals for 5 days. Vital signs within acceptable limits. No immediate red flags identified. Recommend standard evaluation per clinical protocol.

caseFiles.raw_notes: Patient feels tired all day. Headache mostly in the morning. Sleep quality poor. Works long hours at computer.
caseFiles.structured_summary: 32-year-old female presenting with persistent headache and fatigue for 1 week. Vital signs within acceptable limits. No immediate red flags identified from initial assessment. Recommend standard evaluation per clinical protocol.

caseFiles.raw_notes: Gradual onset. Worse in cold weather. No swelling visible. Family history of arthritis.

caseFiles.chief_complaint: Severe chest discomfort and shortness of breath
caseFiles.raw_notes: Patient is diabetic. Feels heaviness in chest. Breathlessness on climbing stairs. No radiating pain.
caseFiles.structured_summary: Patient reports: Severe chest discomfort and shortness of breath. Duration: 2 days.

caseFiles.raw_notes: Seasonal pattern. Mild fever initially, now resolved. Productive cough. No blood in sputum.
caseFiles.structured_summary: 40-year-old male presenting with recurring cold and cough for 2 weeks. Seasonal pattern noted. Vital signs within acceptable limits.
caseFiles.doctor_notes: Patient advised rest and hydration. Follow-up in 1 week if not improved.
caseFiles.doctor_decision: Symptomatic treatment approved. No antibiotics needed at this stage.

caseFiles.chief_complaint: Consultation booking with Dr. Ananya Sharma (Cardiologist)
